comments:
Using Eclipse 2.1 M3 on JVM 1.4.1.
I was debugging a tomcat webapp when stepping out of a method. Suddenly I saw 
the scrollbars in the variable view window go besurk, and the entire IDE 
display froze up. Then I shut down Tomcat, and a bit later the IDE became 
responsive again. However, after a few more clicks the entire IDE crashed (shut 
itself down with some problem in the JVM and JVM exit code 128).

Below are the stack traces from the Eclipse log file. I deleted several blocks 
of about 1000 lines each, which were just repetitive lines. I marked the logs 
accordingly.
 when putting

!ENTRY com.rational.clearcase 1 0 Nov 19, 2002 13:21:12.02
!MESSAGE traceLevel = 2(option=null)

Recursive calls in org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer

The exception log may be referring to the tree view inside the variable view 
in the debugger.

Moving to UI

The Tree viewers use recursive algorithms for refresh, setExpanded, etc.
For this to cause a stack overflow, you either need a small stack, or a very 
deep tree.  Since you're running JVM 1.4.1, a small stack is probably not the 
issue.  

Need to understand what debug was trying to do.  It's hard for me to tell from 
the stacks here though.  Moving to Debug for comment.

Dirk, it would really help to have steps to reproduce this, if you have any 
idea what triggered it.  Also, if you still have the full log, please attach 
it (might want to zip it first).

It's difficult to tell if debug is doing anthing wrong here. It looks like we 
are simply trying to render the variables, as requested from the tree viewer 
(i.e. TreeViewer#doUpdateItem). Really need a reproduceable case to see what is 
going on.
Dirk, have you been able to reproduce this problem?

Unfortunately, I have not been able to reproduce the problem (even though the 
original log file snippet submitted with this report confirms that some problem 
occurred.)
Marking as later for now. Please re-open if you can make it happen again.
Also got it to hang by trying to copy variable t.  Filed bug 27166 for this.

Fixed in AbstractTreeViewer.
Also added regression test.
Darin, could you please verify?
